page.title: 07ATTITUDES FARLEY HILL LUTON
page.content: The following observations were made on life on Farley Hill Estate. These views were expressed by a group of 12/13 year olds, 25 in all. They felt generally happy about living on the estate, one described it as quiet, clean and friendly. The group was pleased with the recent addition of a BMX track, a sort of cross-country area for bikes. A number of requests for more things to do in the evenings and at night were made. A majority would like some extra facilities such as a cinema or youth club. Four members commented adversely on ethnic minority groups but this unfortunate reflection of racialism was eclipsed by the feelings of most who were happy with their homes and neighbours.
